column4: Can someone tell me how to install https://launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/kicad/0.0.20100314-1build0.1/+build/2011249 and all of its dependencies?
did you download the deb package listed there?
yes, but that contains a possibly large tree of dependencies.
(the difference between apt-get and dpkg)
did you open a terminal...cd to it's locations  and   sudp dpkg -i kicad_0.0.20100314-1build0.1_amd64.deb
I already did that.
ok and was was the read out ?  pasbing.com the readout
it then says some dependencies are missing.
ok  now try   sudo apt-get install -f
that of course doesn't work, because the package didn't get installed.
well if you did the sudo dpkg -i   and it complained of dependencies...what was the depency read out?
all kinds of packages that are available, but I don't want to install those manually.
I need to see the read out
that's the relevant bit.
I am asking for a way to say
install package foo and all its dependencies.
just from a different place. Is there no way to do that?
ah ok   mm   well unless you get a different build of kicad  you will have to manually install the proper version of dependecies
I tried building it manually, but their C++ is not C++.
is this particular cad application necessary for your work?
of course it is.
http://kicad.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Download
scroll to bottom of that link
